title: Understanding Ecell◦ and Spontaneity
text: The standard cell potential, Ecell◦, is a measure of the voltage difference between two half-cells in an electrochemical cell under standard conditions. A positive Ecell◦ indicates a spontaneous reaction. What does this imply about the Gibbs free energy change (∆Go)?

title: Linking Ecell◦ to Gibbs Free Energy
text: Recall the relationship between Gibbs free energy change (∆Go) and the standard cell potential (Ecell◦): $$∆Go=-nFEcell◦$$, where $$n$$ is the number of moles of electrons transferred and F is the Faraday constant. What does a positive Ecell◦ mean for ∆Go?

title: Calculating Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: Given the equation $$∆Go=-nFEcell◦$$, if Ecell◦ is positive, what will be the sign of ∆Go?

title: Conclusion on Reaction Spontaneity
text: A negative Gibbs free energy change (∆Go) indicates that a reaction is spontaneous. How does this relate to the initial statement about Ecell◦ and ∆Go?
